Key Match Events: Dyson Daniels hit a 3-pointer in front of the New Orleans Pelicans' bench during a 126-111 victory for the Atlanta Hawks.
Larry Nance Jr. had a third-quarter dunk and a corner 3-pointer, both in front of the Pelicans' bench.
Hawks guard Garrison Matthews was assessed a flagrant foul for a hard forearm to the mid-section of Pelicans guard Jose Alvarado.
Post-Match Reflections: Dyson Daniels expressed that he was just having fun and wanted to let the Pelicans' bench know the 3-pointer was worth 3 points.
Daniels mentioned that he had circled this game on his calendar and was determined to play despite a recent hip strain.
Larry Nance Jr. reflected on the competitive yet friendly nature of the interactions with the Pelicans' bench.
Daniels shared his feelings about being traded from New Orleans to Atlanta, noting it was unexpected but he is happy in Atlanta.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game included chippy moments and a flagrant foul incident.
Daniels and Nance were traded from New Orleans to Atlanta in the offseason as part of a deal involving Dejounte Murray.
